data.title: Incorrect number of unsaved files shown after rename symbol
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Rename a symbol that is used in other files

Other files that referenced it are opened and show as dirty in tabs, the file list and the count on the explorer badge, but it still says "1 unsaved" next to the "open editors" heading.

![Incorrect unsaved files count](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/17674704/9bee7276-631e-11e6-8885-04c025a8c306.png)

data.title: How to prevent code changes while using beautify command
data.body:
when working with the repository in vscode by using the command  

> shift+alt+f => editor.action.format

makes changes to code that are not inline with the repository coding guidelines .
especially when a PR needs to be made, it shows lot of changes. especially in huge files.

How to counter this?

data.title: Use content hash to decide if a file if dirty indicator should show or not

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. enter any character or whitespace
2. delete that character or whitespace

Visual Studio Code will now show that the file has changed (i.e. not the same as before making and undoing the changes) even though it's the same as when it was opened, and when u go to git it will not show the file among changed files which is correct since the file is exactly the same. 
This works well in Atom.io.
This is annoying since whenever you try to close such file, the save file dialog will pop up, and also you can't be sure whether file has really changed or not, so you would have to undo all changes with "ctrl + z".

data.title: Communicate an extension's deprecated status
data.body:
The Marketplace is adding functionality to deprecate extensions. 

We'll want to indicate something to the user in product. Something like

> This extension is deprecated and is no longer maintained, however, you are free to continue using it. 

@joaomoreno any way you would change the messaging? any thoughts on the UI? 

I was thinking something along these lines. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/17671063/d05ab8e4-62c9-11e6-9185-78350e659a33.png)

Ping @hamenon

data.title: Debug - TypeScript breakpoints ignored
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.5.0-insider (2e54e84905a76b2278c7c0bccc86a69f03b2d5d4, 2016-08-15T06:04:11.629Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Put breakpoint in `*.ts` file
2. You get nice red dot: 
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/17667759/420ede48-62d4-11e6-8b4d-7a5ee5606443.png)
3. As soon as you start debugger it will turn into gray one: 
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/17667768/4fadcdde-62d4-11e6-8da1-f1e8c77727ea.png)
   with hint: `Breakpoint ignored because generated code not found (source map problem?)`

But I don't think there is an issue with source maps - because if I put `debugger` on that line then it is hit and `ts` source file is presented

data.title: Editable TextDocumentContentProvider for extensions
data.body: I'm just getting started with extension development so please forgive me if this is a inappropriate feature request. I'm looking to create an extension that with allow me to select a block of code in a source language (i.e. html) and have the option to edit the block in a different language (i.e. jade/pug). I would imagine it would behave similarly to the TextDocumentContentProvider, but have the ability to edit in the secondary window, then transpile back to the source when completed. I didn't see anything in the API documents that would allow me to do this now. Thanks.

data.title: C# Extension & Debugger Unsupported Linux Platform
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Linux Manjaro KDE Version (Arch x64)
                    uname -a --> Linux elias-pc 4.4.16-1-MANJARO #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Jul 27 21:09:47 UTC 2016 x86_64 GNU/Linux

I get the following error when trying to install the .NET Debugger with Ctrl-Shift-P: Debug: Download .NET Core Debugger

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12485194/17664643/de573c0c-62f5-11e6-943e-1695a61f732a.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Manjaro KDE Version
2. Install dotnet-cli from the AUR with the following patch http://www.pastefile.com/5T8qbi (Sadly there was no other option available which worked for installing the dotnet-cli on this system)
3. Install visual-studio-code
4. Install C# Extension
5. Try to install the .NET Core Debugger

I'm aware that you didn't focus on such linux systems yet so the error message is quite obvious. I wonder though, if you will try to bring better support for C# development for other linux platforms like Arch Linux as well.

data.title: Add ability to merge local git branches
data.body:
It does not currently appear possible to merge local git branches in VS Code.

Quite a common workflow is to have a "development" branch to develop new features on (or alternatively have feature specific branches). When the development is finished, the development branch is then merged into the "master" branch before release.

This can be done via the integrated terminal, but as VS Code's git implementation is so wizzy, it would be great to be able to replicate this workflow using the GUI.

data.title: [json] Hover/completion not working for scoped packages
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.5.0-insider (1.5.0-insider)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Feature Request:

Can you guys please add the ability to see the latest version of a package that starts with an @ symbol? Currently, if I hover any package in my package.json I can see what is the latest version, but with stuff like @types and @angular and others, I'm not able to see it so I'd have to manually search for what is the latest version of their packages.

data.title: Intelisense doesn't work at all
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.5.0-insider (1.5.0-insider) || Version 1.4.0 (1.4.0)
- OS Version: OSX El Captain 10.11.6

I had a project on my Macbook where the intelisense was working perfectly, then my Macbook has been sent for repair and in the meantime I am using a different one. I have cloned the project I was working on, did an `npm i` and `typings i`, then downloaded VSCode and I was ready to rock, but sadly intelisense doesn't work at all. (No code completion on imports, no go to definition, nothing.) With the very same vscode version (installed before) and same project codebase revision on my colleague Mac it works well. And with a freshly installed vscode insider too.

I know its not enough for a bug report, but sadly this is all I can tell, there are no errors, it just doesn't work for me while works for others for the very same codebase.

"Reinstall" doesn't help and there is no error in the console.

What other info should I provide to make this bug solvable?

data.title: Quick open file search: flickers when typing while open
data.body: Looks like a regression from 1.4.

data.title: Esc is behaving differently in in Find functionality when editor has selection
data.body:
<kbd>esc</kbd> is behaving differently in following scenarios

Scenario 1:
1. Select some text where there is at least one find match
2. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>f</kbd> to open find widget. Provide search string
3. <kbd>esc</kbd> to cancel
Notice that selection is cleared

Scenario 2:
1. Select some text where there is no find match
2. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>f</kbd> to open find widget. Provide search string
3. <kbd>esc</kbd> to cancel
Notice that selection is not cleared

See the attached videos:

![jul-28-2016 12-27-58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/17209810/6731d720-54bf-11e6-9695-3830b25b2c61.gif)

![jul-28-2016 12-28-55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/17209815/6c01076c-54bf-11e6-9766-1b9a054f81dc.gif)

data.title: Cannot type until extension host is started
vscode.commands.executeCommand doesn't wait for other executeCommand
cut code replaced by empty copy command

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. select some code
2. press ctrl+x
3. select a place to paste the code but accidentally press ctrl-c.
4. press ctrl+v

Upon pressing ctrl+v nothing is pasted as the ctrl+c has caused the value to be overwritten with nothing so nothing is pasted. Now I have to press ctrl+z a few times to get my old code back and do the same process to be sure not to accidently press ctrl+c again. Precious seconds lost, so sad.

data.title: Scala plugin color error.
data.body:
![bad color](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15964600/17654104/e34398e2-62d1-11e6-9593-56955135646f.png)
![correct color](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15964600/17654105/e34792a8-62d1-11e6-8d94-7d13d9401ffd.png)
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Write a test.scala file.
package progscala2.introscala.shapes;

object Message {
    object Exit
    object Finished
    case class Response(message: String)
}

import akka.actor.Actor

class ShapesDrawingActor extends Actor {
    import Messages._                    //here  
    def receive = {
        case s: Shape =>
            s.draw( str => println( s"ShapesDrawingActor:$str" ))
            sender ! Response( s"ShapesDrawingActor: $s drawn")
        case Exit =>
            println($"ShapesDrawingActor:exiting... ")
            sender ! Finished
        case unexpected =>  //default. Equivalent to "unexpected: Any"
            val response = Response( s"ERROR: Unknown message: $unexpected")
            println(s"ShapesDrawingActor:$response")
            sender !response
    }
}

2.then color error

data.title: Support non-block cursor types in integrated terminal
data.body:
I dislike how the block cursor hides characters when cursorBlinking is set to false, but the blinking drives me crazy. This is only setting right now:  

```
// Controls whether the terminal cursor blinks.  
"terminal.integrated.cursorBlinking": false,  
```

I would appreciate it if you could add these:  

```
// Controls the terminal cursor animation style, possible values are 'blink' and 'solid'  
"terminal.integrated..cursorBlinking": "solid",  

// Controls the terminal cursor style, accepted values are 'block', 'line' and 'underline'  
"terminal.integrated..cursorStyle": "line",
```

data.title: preview for rst file is not updated when content changed...
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:41:29.513Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.2.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1.open a rst file and edit it.
2.use command + shift +v to open a preview for this file.
3.close preview
4.make some modify on this rst file.
5.open preview again but it have not been updated...
